{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided, the stillborn infant has a small pelvis, shallow intergluteal cleft, club feet, and absence of the sacrum and lumbar vertebrae. These findings are consistent with the diagnosis of caudal regression syndrome. The strongest predisposing factor for this condition is maternal diabetes. Maternal diabetes has been associated with an increased risk of caudal regression syndrome, which is characterized by malformations of the lower spine and limbs. Maternal oligohydramnios, intrauterine alcohol exposure, and chromosome 18 trisomy are not typically associated with caudal regression syndrome.", "answer_choice": "C"}
